summary: SummarySay goodbye to damaging hot tools and hello to healthy, bouncy hair. Kitsch's Rosewood Jumbo Satin Flexi Rods create flowing, loose curls or relaxed waves.
details: DetailsFeaturesLess heat means stronger, healthier strands over timeNo tugging! 100% vegan satin glides through hair to prevent breakage & frictionGreat for most hair types & texturesItem 2614290How To UseTake a section of slightly damp hair from the top of your head.Place the rod at the ends & tuck them as you begin rolling downward toward your head.Keep rolling until the rod is tight against your scalp, then bend ends to snap & secure in place.Continue with the next roller, then link it through the first roller before you snap it together to help them stay secure.Repeat the process until all rollers are in place; wear overnight or until hair fully dries.
how_to_use: Take a section of slightly damp hair from the top of your head.Place the rod at the ends & tuck them as you begin rolling downward toward your head.Keep rolling until the rod is tight against your scalp, then bend ends to snap & secure in place.Continue with the next roller, then link it through the first roller before you snap it together to help them stay secure.Repeat the process until all rollers are in place; wear overnight or until hair fully dries.

reviews.headline: so, WOW, these work great
reviews.comments: I didn't expect these satin rollers to work. I was so wrong.  I keep my curly hair healthy by not using heat rollers or curling irons ever.  I usually wrap my wettish hair into a bun to straighten it and avoid frizz.  That works well.  But these satin rollers took my look to a higher level.  I can use just 4 of them or all 6 of them for different looks. I can roll forward or backward or sideways to change the look. My hair is dry by morning and has amazing controlled curl and founce when I walk.  They are cushioned inside, so easy to sleep on them. I am so glad I found these!

reviews.headline: Don't listen to the negative reviews. These are great!
reviews.comments: I have been using these rods for years now. Only reason I bought a second pack is because I misplaced my original pack. I'm guessing but I think the people using them that are complaining aren't applying the rods correctly. My hair is fine, I use them at bedtime and wrap with a silk scarf, they stay every night.

reviews.headline: Not made for thick corse hair
reviews.comments: These rods would work great if you don't have thick hair. I bought these with the intent on giving myself a blowout. Unfortunately my hair is too thick and corse, the rod won't stay in place unless I pin it down, which defeats the purpose.

reviews.headline: Didn't stay in place.
reviews.comments: I really wanted these to work, but they wouldn't stay in place. It's could've been user error, but I ended up returning them.

reviews.headline: Don't buy!
reviews.comments: These are terrible! The satin does not hold or grip any type of fine hair. You have to twist until it hurts. Even with damp hair. These are such a waste. Do not buy

reviews.headline: slipped out
reviews.comments: I have thick, wavy hair but it's too smooth so these slipped out. I even linked them together in pairs but they still slipped out within 10 minutes.

reviews.headline: My hair is too fine - they slipped right out
reviews.comments: I wish they would have worked for me!

reviews.headline: Save your money
reviews.comments: Save your money, they don't stay in your hair. They're difficult to use and unless you're good at puzzles, there's no way to get them to stay in your hair.

reviews.headline: Non-functional
reviews.comments: If you have medium-fine hair, this will not stay in. The material does not work for this. You'd have to roll the hair super tight and that will only cause tension damage and discomfort when sleeping. And after all that, the curls were not great. Very loose and only at the bottom. The idea to do this in satin was good in theory but in reality just doesn't work well for this technique. I'm sure the others work fine but this was not it. You're better off giving the other ones a try.

reviews.headline: Don't Recommend
reviews.comments: I have medium length hair with layers. Would not hold my hair at all. Slipped straight out. Attempted to use it with damp hair like the package says and used it with product in my hair. No luck either time. Maybe it works better for longer hair. Dont recommend for medium or short hair.

reviews.headline: Doesn't hold hair and slips right out
reviews.comments: I wish I had read the comments before I purchased these. I roll my hair, and as soon as I snap the end, it slides right out. I have thicker, wavy, longer than shoulder-length hair.

reviews.headline: Does not work
reviews.comments: These flexi rods do not work they slip out and do not stay rolled up its a struggle to get one in let alone 4. You'd be better off with regular rollers if you wanted these gor ease of use.

reviews.headline: Skip
reviews.comments: I liked rhe appeal of a satin hair rod but no.. the satin would not hold my hair in place and i could not hold a single hair on the rods.

reviews.headline: Not recommended
reviews.comments: Doesnt hold hair tightâ€¦

reviews.headline: Not for short bob length hair
reviews.comments: I have short chin length bob cut hair, these are definitely for longer hair.  They would not stay in my hair to save my life.  I woke up with a bunch of rollers loose in my bonnet.  I would not purchase again.

reviews.headline: These are worthless
reviews.comments: These rollers do not stay in place. No matter how taunt you roll and secure they slip. Not sure how these are so popukar or recived 4.4 stars.  Am thinking there is a better brand out there and i plan to find it because this cant be it.

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: I like it easy to uss

reviews.headline: Bad Product
reviews.comments: Simply put, this is a bad product that will not hold hair or stay in place. Complete fail.

reviews.headline: Great for natural hair
reviews.comments: I'm definitely probably not the target audience for this product with bra-strap length natural hair (locs)...BUT...the smaller flexi rods great! They're soft enough to basically twist into bantu knots. I did have to get 2 packs for my hair type, but they're soo much softer than the foam flexi rods that I typically use.

reviews.headline: Surprisingly AMAZING for natural hair
reviews.comments: I'm definitely probably not the target audience for this product with bra-strap length natural hair (locs)...BUT...the jumbo satin flexi rods are soo good for natural hair. Perfect for a cute lil bump on my ends. I did have to get 2 packs for my hair type. No clue about the comments about them slipping out, I use a bonnet so I've had a different experience.

media.headline: The Jumbo Flexi Rods make gorgeous curls!

faceoff_positive.comments: I wanted to take a break from blowdrying my hair because it was falling out so I gave these a try and im actually very surprised and happy with my purchase. I don't get the reviews here because its actually a great product. Girls at work think i actually spend time doing my curls. People that dont know me think i have natural curls. I have indian hair that is a bit frizzy, slightly wavy in some areas. Its thinning now but its a okay amount and up to my elbows. I think to use this, you really need to develop a technique. I was using socks before this lol so i already had it figured out. If you part your hair in three sections this will be very usuable and you will be able to confotably sleep in it. Start with semi damp hair. Then section the crown part of your head - so from you eyebrows arches on both sides going to just right before the highest point of your head. Brush this section forward. You want to kind or roll your hair all one part of the foam and that to in the center. Hold your hair from the ends tightly and angle a little upwards. Place the roller right on top and try to roll the ends nearly in the center, as you roll the end should wrap in with the hair as you go up. Keep it tight. This the hardest part but easy omce you get the hang of it.Then when you get the the base hold the hair secure on both sides and fold the roller on both side coming to the front of the face so its resting on your forehead. If you did it right it will be secure. Then part remaining hair in two even sections left and right. Comb one section, hold the hair tightly at a bit of an angle and grab the end. For the side you want to roll up diagonally. Roll the end in, hair being rolled on in the center of the roller on itself, continue rolling till you get to the very base of you head and fold the roller on both sides. It should be in like a horseshoe position except ends folded in. It should land slighly above and to the back side of your ears. And thats it. Once you get the hang of it, itll take 10 minutes. Youll wake up with gorgeous curls. I brush them and use a curling mouse in the morning to bounce them. And ill do the same thing the next night to keep them curly.
faceoff_positive.headline: Easy to use and give nice curls

faceoff_negative.comments: Ive been getting a similar for 20 years by winding my hair into a bun, but thought I'd give these a try to see whether it would give me a better or different result. Firstly, I cannot understand why they'd make these out of satin. They're so difficult to put in and then the only way to stop them sliding out of my hair is to roll them super tight (which is painful and I don't want to go bald) or clip them in (which defeats the purpose of using these). I've seen other brands made from cotton and linen, and if I were going to try these again I'd buy those fabrics instead. Secondly, the press studs are impossible to get undone. I'm terrified I'm going to either rip my hair out or rip off a nail every time I tried to open them. In fact, I ripped the top of my nail off opening one tonight, so now I'm in pain and annoyed, which is why I'm leaving the review. I've seen several other brands that have clips (like on bathers) which seem much more practical. Personally I'll be sticking to my bun method, which is much simpler and more comfortable.
faceoff_negative.headline: Poor quality
